channel.title: Issues
channel.description: Is anyone pretty good with portforwarding? I went to 192.168.0.1 and made internal and external ports 43594 open on 192.168.0.12 on TCP and UDP and clicked enable. Then I went to my Firewall and unchecked "Block fragmented IP Packets" and "Block Port Scan Detection". Then I went into my windows Firewall and made two inbound rules to allow on port 43594. My router is a Cisco Dps3825. Can anyone PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE help me? All port checkers still say closed.

item.title: Issues
item.dc:creator: @ladaswa ladaswa
item.description:
@ladaswa wrote:

Is anyone pretty good with portforwarding? I went to 192.168.0.1 and made internal and external ports 43594 open on 192.168.0.12 on TCP and UDP and clicked enable. Then I went to my Firewall and unchecked “Block fragmented IP Packets” and “Block Port Scan Detection”. Then I went into my windows Firewall and made two inbound rules to allow on port 43594. My router is a Cisco Dps3825. Can anyone PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE help me? All port checkers still say closed.

Read full topic
